title: Embedding Custom Data in Atlas
description: A detailed guide to embedding custom datasets into Nomic Atlas for visualization and analysis.

overview.purpose: To enable users to upload and visualize custom datasets by generating embeddings and creating maps in Nomic Atlas.
use_cases: Visualizing text-based datasets like customer feedback or survey responses.
Clustering high-dimensional numerical data for pattern recognition.
Embedding metadata for advanced searches and filtering.

prerequisites: A dataset in CSV, JSON, or another structured format.
A valid Nomic Atlas API key for uploading data and creating embeddings.
Understanding of embeddings and their role in data visualization.

steps.title: Prepare Your Dataset
steps.description: Ensure your dataset is clean, structured, and formatted correctly for embedding generation.

python_script.description: Automate the embedding and visualization process using Python.
python_script.code:
import requests

# Step 1: Prepare your data
data = [
    {'id': '1', 'text': 'This is a sample text for embedding.'},
    {'id': '2', 'text': 'Another example of text data.'}
]

# Step 2: Generate embeddings
embedding_url = 'https://api-atlas.nomic.ai/v1/embeddings/create'
headers = {
    'Authorization': 'Bearer <API_KEY>',
    'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}
response = requests.post(embedding_url, headers=headers, json={'data': data})
embeddings = response.json()

# Step 3: Upload embeddings to Atlas
upload_url = 'https://api-atlas.nomic.ai/v1/data/upload'
response = requests.post(upload_url, headers=headers, json={'data': embeddings})

# Step 4: Create a map in Atlas
map_url = 'https://api-atlas.nomic.ai/v1/maps/create'
map_payload = {
    'name': 'Custom Data Map',
    'data': embeddings
}
response = requests.post(map_url, headers=headers, json=map_payload)
print(response.json())

notes: Ensure your dataset is clean and well-structured before generating embeddings.
Metadata fields can be used to enhance filtering and search capabilities within maps.
Refer to the Nomic Atlas API documentation for advanced embedding options and parameters.
